item.title: End NV-359 at US-95
item.description: End NV-359 at US-95. Turn right for US-95 south to Tonopah and Las Vegas. Continue straight for US-95 north to Fallon and Reno.

item.title: End NV-359 North at US-95
item.description: End NV-359 north at US-95 in Hawthorne.

item.title: NV-359 North Approaching US-95
item.description: NV-359 North approaching US-95 in Hawthorne.

item.title: NV-359 North - Hawthorne
item.description: Hawthorne - Elevation 4,320 Feet on NV-359 North.

item.title: NV-359 North - Anchorite Pass
item.description: Anchorite Pass - Elevation 7,626 Feet on NV-359 North.

item.title: NV-359 North
item.description: NV-359 north in Mineral County. This is the first NV-359 shield after the state line.

item.title: NV-359 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on NV-359 north. Distance to Hawthorne. This sort of sign is common in Nevada where there is only one city listed as a destination.

item.title: Welcome To Nevada - NV-359 North
item.description: Welcome to Nevada - The Silver State, Mineral County Line on NV-359 north. Taken at the Nevada - California state line.

item.title: Mineral County Line on NV-359 North
item.description: Mineral County line at California border

item.title: US-95 South at NV-359 South
item.description: US-95 south at NV-359 west to Lee Vining and Bridgeport

item.title: Welcome To Nevada - NV-359 North
item.description: Welcome to Nevada on California border. Welcome to Nevada is the blue on silver design.
